Here are some of the advances over Australopithecus africanus that are seen in Homo habilis & Homo rudolfensis:
 * larger brain size (590 - 710 cc in OH7 and 775 in ER1470 / Australopithecines are about 400 - 500 cc)
 * reduced molar size
 * more mobility in thumb & expanded ends of fingers as seen in OH7
 * foot of OH8 shows adaptations for bipedalism that are more pronounced than what is seen in Australopithecines (shorter toes / large big toe which is less flared / fully developed arch)
 * foramen magnum more forward for erect posture in OH24
 * less postorbital constriction (narrowing behind eye orbits) seen in OH24 & ER1470
 
 These are definite transitional features that put both Homo habilis & Homo rudolfensis specimens between the Australopithecines and Homo erectus. Larger brain size and adaptations for greater manual dexterity & more efficient bipedal walking are exactly what you'd expect for these transitional forms.
